adudecalledleo.lionutils.unsafe

Interface HeapMemory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public interface HeapMemory
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Represents a block of memory allocated on the heap by UnsafeAccess.
    Since:
    5.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long address()
      Gets the memory block's address on the heap.
      void close()
      Frees the block of memory and invalidates this instance.
      void copyFrom(HeapMemory src, long srcOffset, long dstOffset, long bytes)
      Copies a specific amount of bytes from the source memory block to this memory block.
      long getAddress(long offset)
      Gets an address from a specific offset.
      byte getByte(long offset)
      Gets a byte from a specific offset.
      char getChar(long offset)
      Gets a char from a specific offset.

      Gets a double from a specific offset.

      Reallocates the memory block with a new size.
      void set(long offset, long bytes, byte value)
      Sets all bytes in a specific section of the memory block to a specific value.
      long size()
      Gets the memory block's size in bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        long size()
        Gets the memory block's size in bytes.
        Returns:
        the block size

      • address

        long address()
        Gets the memory block's address on the heap.
        Returns:
        the block address

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()

        Checks if the memory block is valid or not.

        A memory block is valid after being allocated and invalidated after being freed.
        Returns:
        true if valid, false otherwise

      • set

        void set(long offset,
         long bytes,
         byte value)
        Sets all bytes in a specific section of the memory block to a specific value.
        Parameters:
        offset - offset to start from
        bytes - amount of bytes to set
        value - value to set bytes to

      • reallocate

        void reallocate(long newSize)
        Reallocates the memory block with a new size.
        Parameters:
        newSize - new block size

      • copyFrom

        void copyFrom(HeapMemory src,
              long srcOffset,
              long dstOffset,
              long bytes)
        Copies a specific amount of bytes from the source memory block to this memory block.
        Parameters:
        src - source memory block
        srcOffset - source offset
        dstOffset - destination offset
        bytes - amount of bytes to copy

      • getByte

        Returns:
